Title: An uncommon site of Streptococcus Pneumoniae colonization leading to recurrent pneumococcal disease
Abstract: © The Author 2016.This report describes a case of relapsing pneumococcal peritonitis. The postulated source of infection was vaginal colonization and secondary adherence of pneumococci to an intrauterine contraceptive device. After immunization with a conjugate pneumococcal vaccine, her antibody levels were observed. She remained infection free at the 2-year follow-up investigation.
